com.bigdata.bfs

Class TestAppendBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • junit.framework.TestCase2
          • com.bigdata.btree.AbstractBTreeTestCase
            • com.bigdata.service.AbstractEmbeddedFederationTestCase
              • com.bigdata.bfs.AbstractRepositoryTestCase
                • com.bigdata.bfs.TestAppendBlock
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    junit.framework.Test

    public class TestAppendBlock
extends AbstractRepositoryTestCase
    Test atomic append operations on the file data index for the BigdataFileSystem. This also tests the correct assignment of block identifiers, the ability to count the #of blocks in a file version, the ability to visit the block identifiers for a file version, the ability to read a specific block for a file version, and the ability to read all data for a file version from an input stream. FIXME test where there is only a single index partition and where there are several. This will exercise both the logic that locates the index partition into which the atomic append will go and the logic that computes the next block identifer for the file version when entering a new partition. These tests can be run by establishing the appropriate partitions in the data index for the embedded federation.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      • test_atomicAppendStressTest

        public void test_atomicAppendStressTest()
                                 throws IOException
        A stress test for writing a partial and full blocks on a file and reading back its data. Each pass writes on a different file.

        Note: By virtue of how the file names are choosen this also tests atomic append of a file when there is an existing file and the new file would be (a) before; and (b) after the existing file in the index order.

        Throws:
        IOException
